How to create a serverless static website with Strapi and Nuxpresso

As a developer sometimes I need to publish websites for demo purposes, so I really need an easy solution that has the following goals:

  • fast design
  • creative design tools
  • fast deployment
  • serverless


I was working on some projects using Strapi (porting from WP or similar CMS) in order to have a real headless CMS, easy to setup, maintain and open to development.


And what about coding? Yes whatever you use as frontend (Vue, Nuxt, React, Angular, etc.) you need by the way to code your HTML, CSS and some JS. I know, sometimes developers coding the HTML markup and relative CSS is a boring process, even using templates that you created before for some other project.


I wanted something different that could improve my creative process experience with something that was WYSIWYG and that could make the markup job for me.


I created MOKAStudio a frontend application based on blocks design, that works as a developer tool. I can create pages, templates, components, widgets, sliders, flipcards, modal, popups and more without coding a single line of HTML and CSS. Yes.

Give it a try. It's open source and free, with a full Strapi integration thanks to a custom template.


Serverless or not serverless?


What means serverless? A website that can be hosted on any webserver, full static, that doesn't require any API or any other server or database to connect to.

I decided to go with NuxtJS because is the best that I know and also because MOKAStudio is developed using VueJS so I could reuse the same components with no problems.


With nuxpresso you can decide to go full static serverless or if you need a production Strapi deployment you can still connect to it. It's your choice depending on a single project.


Going servless full static


With Nuxpresso (NuxtJS) when you generate with static mode, during the generation performs the following:

  • generate the routes
  • generate the static pages
  • generate the dynamic routes based on slugs (you can customize) payload included
  • if you are using local upload plugin it will copy the Strapi ./public/uploads folder to NuxtJS ./static/uploads


At the end of the generation process you will have your ./dist folder with your static website.


Just deploy the ./dist folder without any build or generate command and your website is ready to be published.


Updating pages and content


When you need to update any content (page, media, etc) using MOKAStudio it will automatically update your Strapi data.

Then you can run a new generate command, commit your changes and your site will be updated automatically.


Pros of serverless


The main benefits are:

  • working in local environment (development) to create, change, update any content
  • no server is needed
  • no extra cost for expensive infrastructure (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, etc.)
  • no server maintenance or update
  • no database backup
  • fastest deployment time
  • limit downtime risks due to server bottlenecks
  • fast response
  • secure by the core since is just HTML, CSS and JS
  • easy portability and backup (using repos)
  • no passwords, permissions settings using a local environemnt



Cons of serverless

When you have a website that has many updates, or even many editors, publishers you may need a production Strapi deployment


  • frequent updates requires a new generate command with NuxtJS


Workflow scenario

With nuxpresso you can have different workflow scenario.


local environment


  • no server required
  • full static


full production

  • local development with MOKAStudio
  • production nuxpresso deploy
  • production Strapi
  • use external upload provider (Cloudinary, CDN, etc.)


staging / production


  • local development with MOKAStudio
  • production nuxpresso deploy
  • staging with a local Strapi installation
  • transfer data to production Strapi with MOKAStudio
  • use external upload provider (Cloudinary, CDN, etc.)


What more?


I forgot. This website as well as my personal portfolio (https://antonionardone.com) are fully serverless and created with Nuxpresso.
